free_limit.description: Optional: Free limit for how many yats the user may purchase

is_active.description: Optional: If the user is active, updating to true triggers user activation related events

payment_method_id.description: Use stored payment method (only with `Provider` method)

provider.description:
Payment provider (required with `Provider` or `Card` methods)
 payment types.

pubkey.description: Optional: The user's public key to associate with this emoji id

set_default.description: Set card payment method as default.

refresh_token.description: Refresh token obtained from login request

code.description: Auth code of newly or previously setup 2FA

global_scopes.description: A list of fine-grained permissions the user may perform.

organization_roles.description:
The role this user has in each organisation. Organisations are currently not used, but are reserved for
 future operations.

organization_scopes.description:
The scopes that are granted to this user for each organisation. Organisations are currently not used, but are
 reserved for future operations.

pubkeys.description:
A list of this user's public keys. When yats are deployed to the blockchain, users prove ownership of their
 Yats with digital signatures, proving knowledge of the private keys that "own" the yat. In the centralised
 implementation of Yat, the server will custody the users' wallets and private keys, but in other respects the
 ownership model is the same.

items.description: A hexadecimal representation of a 256-bit public key.

role.description: The role assigned to this user. Roles grant authority to user accounts to perform certain actions.

created_at.description: A UTC timestamp for when this order was initially created.

eligible_for_refund.description: Whether an order is eligible for a refund via an admin.

expires_at.description:
Checkout carts have a limited time before they expire. This prevents users from blocking inventory from being
 sold to other customers. The expiry time is configurable on the server and is typically 5 minutes.

id.description: The unique identifier for this order

misc_refunded_total_in_cents.description: The total of miscellaneous refund amounts retirned to the order.

order_items.description: The list of individual line items making up this order.

client_fee_in_cents.description: The fee attributable to the referral partner, in addition to the nominal unit price, in USD cents.

code_id.description: The code associated with this order item for providing a discount.

company_fee_in_cents.description: The fee attributable to the service host or company, in addition to the nominal unit price, in USD cents.

created_at.description: A UTC timestamp for when this order item was created.

emoji_id.description: The emoji id that is being purchased

id.description: A unique identifier for this order item

item_type.description: The type of order. Current enumerations are EmojiId and Discount

order_id.description: The id of the order this order item

parent_id.description: Parent order item's ID, set for discounts and fees

quantity.description: The number of items in the line order. For emoji id sales, this should always be one.

unit_price_in_cents.description: The nominal, non-discounted price of the item, in USD cents.

updated_at.description: A UTC timestamp for when ny field in the order item was modified.

order_number.description: The order number is the last 8 characters of the order's ID for user display purposes.

organization_id.description:
The organization id of the user, if applicable. This will generally be null, unless the purchase is coming via
 a referral programme.

paid_at.description: A UTC timestamp for when payment for this order was received. Will be null if no payment has been made yet.

payment_method_data.description: Payment method data for payment methods that provide QR code checkout options set via checkout.

refunded_total_in_cents.description: The total of refund amounts for the order.

seconds_until_expiry.description: A convenience field indicating how long before `expires_at` is reached.

status.description:
The order of the status. Orders start in 'Draft' status, then move to 'PendingPayment' and finally, 'Paid',
 unless they are 'Cancelled'.

total_in_cents.description: The sum of all the items in this order, plus fees, in USD cents.

updated_at.description: A UTC timestamp for the last time any field in this order was modified.

user.description: The details of the user placing this order.

user_id.description: The identifier of the user placing this order

delete.description: Optional: hashes of records to delete

items.description: An emoji record hash. Every emoji id's set of data records is summarized in a Merkle tree. The leaf nodes of that tree are the hash representation of the various concrete emoji id records. This schema describes the hash format for emoji id records.

insert.description: Optional: list of records to add

items.description: A data record stored in an emoji record. For ergonomics, the data is represented as a string, irrespective of whether the underlying data is a string or not. Typically, binary data will be encoded as a hexadecimal string, but this is not a guarantee. Refer to the individual record type specifications to determine the form the data will take.

tag.description: Category ID as a hex number

merkle_root.description: Optional: merkle root (use WASM to generate)

EmojiId.description: The emoji id is the key value used in the Emoji ID key-value lookup system. As the name suggests, the id consists solely of emoji characters from a [carefully curated list](/docs/api-ref/#list-users-emoji-ids) ranging in length from one to six characters. Emoji ids are 'owned' in the sense that there is a private-public keypair associated with the id that granted transfer and write-access rights to anyone with knowledge of the emoji id's private key. The primary use of emoji ids is to associate useful related data with the id. This creates a unified identity around that emoji id. For example, someone may associate a website, a twitter handle and a BTC payment address to an emoji id. Those three disparate entities can then be easily accessed using the same emoji id.

data.description: Category data in text or hex encoded formats

hash.description: Hash identifies record, can be used to delete records

tag.description: Category as a hex string number

status.description:
Response status.
 If true, the requested data will be in the result field, null otherwise

views_past_month.description: Number of times emoji viewed during past month

status.description: Status of requested user after completing the login request

emoji_id.description: Emoji ID to express interest in

data.description: The data to pass through to the proxied service

value.description: The response from the proxied service as a String

Pubkey.description: A hexadecimal representation of a 256-bit public key.

availability.description: The availability state of this emoji

available.description: Whether the Emoji ID is available for purchase

discounted_price.description:
Pricing in US cents, e.g. 1024 is 10.24 USD.
 Discounted price is 0 if the emoji is not available

price.description:
Pricing in US cents, e.g. 1024 is 10.24 USD.
 Price is 0 if the emoji is not available

views_past_month.description:
Total lookups using this API, if someone is viewing this Emoji ID
 using their own self hosted node, it will not be counted here

nonce.description: Schnorr signature nonce as a hex

pubkey.description: Public key to authorize usage of a code

signature.description: Schnorr signature as a hex with alternate_id as a challenge

tracking_data.description: Custom tracking data to be associated with a purchase

refresh_token.description: Refresh token obtained from login request

source.description: Required when registering with `alternate_id`, source for non custodial user

availability.description: The availability state of this emoji

available.description: Whether the Emoji ID is available for purchase

discounted_price.description:
Pricing in US cents, e.g. 1024 is 10.24 USD.
 Discounted price is 0 if the emoji is not available

price.description:
Pricing in US cents, e.g. 1024 is 10.24 USD.
 Price is 0 if the emoji is not available

views_past_month.description:
Total lookups using this API, if someone is viewing this Emoji ID
 using their own self hosted node, it will not be counted here

result.description: The specific Emoji ID that the user requests

availability.description: The availability state of this emoji

available.description: Whether the Emoji ID is available for purchase

discounted_price.description:
Pricing in US cents, e.g. 1024 is 10.24 USD.
 Discounted price is 0 if the emoji is not available

price.description:
Pricing in US cents, e.g. 1024 is 10.24 USD.
 Price is 0 if the emoji is not available

views_past_month.description:
Total lookups using this API, if someone is viewing this Emoji ID
 using their own self hosted node, it will not be counted here

height.description: Optional heigth of generated QR code

requires_2fa.description:
Setup 2FA provider (`GoogleAuthenticator`) for account
 Submit `null` to disable 2FA

width.description: Optional width of generated QR code

qr_code_svg.description: Secret as QR code in svg image, will be null when code is disabled

secret.description: Hex encoded secret, will be null when code is disabled

tags.name: User Authentication
tags.description:
From a user experience standpoint, we want encourage the use of magic links.
1. Users request a magic link
2. If 2FA is enabled submit proceed to 2FA.

tags.name: Emoji
tags.description: Emoji endpoints. Endpoints to interact with the supported Emoji character sets.

tags.name: Emoji ID
tags.description: Endpoints for interacting and managing your emoji ids. Endpoints that result in data modification require authentication and the necessary permissions (or scopes). The most common endpoint will be a lookup, i.e. `/emoji_id/{emoji_id}` and does not require authorization, this is when a user wants to get records associated with an Emoji ID.

tags.name: User Interest
tags.description: User Interest endpoints. Endpoints for users to express interest in Emoji IDs.

tags.name: Users
tags.description: User Management. Only applicable for users with custodial wallets.

info.title: Emoji ID API server
info.description: Emoji ID is a directory service that associates almost any type of structured data with a short, memorable identifier the emoji id.
